poem:
"Reflections at Midnight"

Under a Spanish moon, 
platters clang, laughter peals,
night blooms into feast,
a splendid garden of chatter.
While northern lights crown 
silent Swedish dinner,
ice wrapped in reason.

Madness, said one; 
Culture, said another; 
In the orchard of time,
each picks their own fruit,
each stargazer,
their own constellation.

Two clocks, two tongues,
rhythm all their own;
no judgment waits
beneath the patient sky.
